Tax rates for individuals / Ngā reiti tāke mō ngā tāngata

New Zealand has progressive tax rates. The amount of tax you pay depends on your total income for the tax year.

Income tax rates from 1 April 2025

From the 2025-26 tax year, the following rates apply:

Income bandRate
$0 - $15,60010.5%
$15,601 - $53,50017.5%
$53,501 - $78,10030%
$78,101 - $180,00033%
Over $180,00039%

Previous tax rates

Rates for 2024-25 tax year

For the period 1 July 2024 to 31 March 2025, the following rates applied. These rates were introduced partway through the tax year.

The rates were changed by the Taxation (Budget Measures) Act 2024.

Rates before 1 July 2024

Before 1 July 2024, the standard rates were:

  • $0 - $14,000: 10.5%
  • $14,001 - $48,000: 17.5%
  • $48,001 - $70,000: 30%
  • $70,001 - $180,000: 33%
  • Over $180,000: 39%

Independent earner tax credit (IETC)

If you earn between $24,000 and $48,000 a year, you may be entitled to the independent earner tax credit. The maximum credit is $520 per year.

The credit abates at 13 cents in the dollar for income over $44,000. It fully abates at $48,000.

How to check your tax rate

You can check your tax rate by logging into myIR. Go to your income tax account and look at your assessment.
